intro: Bossiaea foliosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Bossiaea foliosa is often found in southern and western regions of Australia.
